description: Development of a comprehensive customer data platform to consolidate customer information from multiple sources, provide real-time analytics, and enable personalized customer experiences across all touchpoints.
client_overview: GlobalTech Solutions Inc. is a leading financial services company with over 2 million customers across North America. Founded in 1995, we provide banking, investment, and insurance services through digital and traditional channels. Our commitment to innovation and customer experience drives our need for advanced data capabilities.
project_scope: Design and implement a centralized customer data warehouse
Integrate data from 12+ existing systems including CRM, billing, and transaction systems
Develop real-time data processing and analytics capabilities
Create customer 360-degree view dashboard for customer service representatives
Implement data governance framework and data quality controls
Build APIs for real-time customer data access
Develop automated reporting and alerting system
Ensure compliance with financial industry regulations (SOX, PCI-DSS, GDPR)
deliverables: Technical Architecture: Comprehensive system architecture documentation and diagrams
Data Warehouse: Fully implemented and tested customer data warehouse
ETL Pipelines: Automated data extraction, transformation, and loading processes
Analytics Dashboard: Real-time customer analytics and reporting interface
API Layer: RESTful APIs for customer data access and integration
Data Governance: Data quality rules, governance policies, and monitoring tools
Documentation: Technical documentation, user guides, and operational procedures
Training Materials: Comprehensive training program for administrators and end-users
Testing Suite: Automated testing framework and test cases
Deployment Package: Production-ready deployment scripts and procedures
success_criteria: Achieve 99.9% data accuracy across all integrated systems
Reduce customer data retrieval time from 5 minutes to under 10 seconds
Enable real-time customer insights for 100% of customer-facing staff
Improve customer service resolution time by 40%
Establish single source of truth for customer data across the organization
Achieve full regulatory compliance with automated audit trails
Enable predictive analytics for customer behavior and risk assessment
Support business growth with scalable data architecture
functional_requirements: Customer data integration from CRM, billing, transaction, and support systems
Real-time data synchronization with sub-second latency for critical updates
Customer 360-degree view with complete transaction and interaction history
Advanced search and filtering capabilities across all customer attributes
Automated data quality validation and cleansing processes
Role-based access control with audit logging for all data access
Customizable dashboard and reporting interface for different user roles
Automated alert system for data quality issues and system anomalies
Data export capabilities in multiple formats (CSV, Excel, PDF, API)
Historical data analysis with trend identification and predictive modeling
Integration with existing business intelligence tools
non_functional_requirements: System must support 500+ concurrent users during peak hours
Response time under 2 seconds for 95% of customer queries
99.9% system availability with maximum 4 hours monthly downtime
Horizontal scalability to support 5 million+ customer records
Data processing capacity of 1 million+ transactions per day
Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of 4 hours for disaster recovery
Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 1 hour for data backup
Support for mobile and tablet interfaces with responsive design
Accessibility compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA standards
technical_requirements: Cloud-native architecture preferably on AWS or Azure platform
Microservices architecture with containerized deployment using Docker/Kubernetes
Data warehouse solution using modern cloud data warehouse (Snowflake, Redshift, or BigQuery)
Real-time streaming data processing using Apache Kafka or cloud-native alternatives
RESTful API design following OpenAPI 3.0 specifications
Modern web frontend using React, Angular, or Vue.js framework
Backend services using Java Spring Boot, .NET Core, or Node.js
Database technologies: PostgreSQL for operational data, cloud data warehouse for analytics
Caching layer using Redis or similar in-memory data store
Message queuing system for asynchronous processing
Monitoring and logging using ELK stack or cloud-native solutions
Infrastructure as Code using Terraform or CloudFormation

performance_requirements.scalability: Support 5 million customer records with linear scaling
performance_requirements.backup_frequency: Automated daily backups with point-in-time recovery

security_requirements: End-to-end encryption using AES-256 for data at rest and TLS 1.3 for data in transit
Multi-factor authentication (MFA) required for all user accounts
Role-based access control (RBAC) with principle of least privilege
Regular security scanning and vulnerability assessments
Comprehensive audit logging with tamper-proof log storage
Data masking and anonymization for non-production environments
Secure API authentication using OAuth 2.0 and JWT tokens
Network security with VPC, firewalls, and intrusion detection
Regular penetration testing by certified security professionals
Employee background checks for all personnel with data access
compliance_requirements: Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance for financial reporting and controls
Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS) Level 1 compliance
General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) compliance for EU customers
California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) compliance for California residents
Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) record-keeping requirements
Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) compliance
Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) compliance for credit-related data
Regional data residency requirements for international customers
integration_requirements: Salesforce CRM system integration using REST APIs
Oracle Billing system integration with real-time transaction feeds
Core banking system integration for account and transaction data
Customer support system (ServiceNow) integration for case management
Marketing automation platform (HubSpot) integration for campaign data
Document management system integration for customer documents
External credit bureau integration for credit scoring and monitoring
Fraud detection system integration for risk assessment
Business intelligence tools integration (Tableau, Power BI)
Email and SMS notification systems integration
Legacy mainframe system integration for historical data
existing_systems: Core Banking Platform (Account and transaction processing)
constraints: Must maintain 24/7 system availability during implementation with zero downtime for critical systems
Limited budget allocation requiring phased implementation approach
Regulatory approval process may extend timeline by 4-6 weeks
Integration with legacy mainframe systems requires specialized expertise
Data migration must be completed during scheduled maintenance windows only
All development must follow existing enterprise architecture standards
Vendor must have existing financial services industry certifications
Implementation must not disrupt existing customer-facing services
All data must remain within specified geographic boundaries
Change management process requires extensive stakeholder approval
assumptions: Source system APIs and documentation will be available and accurate
Business stakeholders will be available for requirements validation within 2 weeks
Existing infrastructure can support additional data processing loads
Current data quality issues will be resolved during the cleansing process
Regulatory requirements will remain stable throughout the project timeline
Third-party system vendors will provide necessary integration support
IT operations team will be available for deployment and testing support
Budget approval for additional infrastructure resources if needed
Change management and user training will be handled by internal teams
Disaster recovery and backup procedures will be tested before go-live

stakeholders.responsibilities: Business requirements and user acceptance testing

risk_factors: Data Quality: Poor source data quality may impact project timeline and require additional cleansing efforts
Integration Complexity: Legacy system integration may prove more complex than anticipated
Regulatory Changes: New regulations may require scope adjustments during implementation
Resource Availability: Key business stakeholders may have limited availability for requirements gathering
Technical Dependencies: Third-party system upgrades may conflict with integration timeline
Change Management: User adoption may be slower than expected requiring additional training
Performance Issues: System performance may not meet requirements under full production load
Security Vulnerabilities: New security threats may require additional security measures
evaluation_criteria: Technical expertise in cloud data warehouse solutions and modern data architecture
Proven experience with financial services data and regulatory compliance requirements
Demonstrated success with similar scale customer data platform implementations
Quality of proposed technical architecture and scalability approach
Team qualifications including relevant certifications and industry experience
Project management methodology and risk mitigation strategies
Cost-effectiveness and total cost of ownership over 5 years
Innovation and use of cutting-edge technologies and best practices
Client references and case studies from similar financial services projects
